N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 620.2 - Regular allowances

State Regulations
(a) Basic amount. The weekly regular basic State training allowance payable with
respect to weeks beginning in a calendar quarter to a trainee shall be an
amount equal to the State-wide average gross benefit rate for four effective
days which obtained under the Unemployment Insurance Law for the first four of
the last five preceding calendar quarters, with fractions of a dollar rounded
up to the next higher multiple of a dollar. (b) Augmentation. (1)

For dependents. Weekly regular allowances
shall be augmented by $5 for each dependent, up to a maximum of six, whom the
trainee supports, excepting dependents who receive State training allowances as
here provided or any other similar training allowances from any public
fund. (2)

After 10th week of
training. Weekly regular allowances shall be augmented after the 10th week of
training: (i) by $10 for trainees who do not
receive any augmentation for dependents; (ii)
by $5 for trainees who receive an
augmentation for one dependent. (c) Reductions. Regular allowances shall be
reduced in any week by the amount of: (1)
unemployment benefits to which the trainee is or would be entitled under the

New York State Unemployment Insurance Law, the provisions for unemployment
compensation for former Federal civilian employees and exservicemen (Chapter
85, title 5, U.S. Code), or any other State or Federal Unemployment

Compensation Act; (2)
earnings in
employment, not connected with the training, for work in excess of 20 hours
during the week; (3)
a sum
equivalent to 1/40 of the training allowance for each compensated hour of work
spent during the week in on-the-job training under the training
program; (4)
any other training
allowance or training assistance payable to the trainee from any public
fund; (5)
a sum proportionate to
the days of unexcused absence from the training facility. (d) Duration. Regular allowances shall be
payable for a period not exceeding 104 weeks with respect to any training
program to which the trainee has been referred. Notes
